Ad Text:
About us

Cadence & Co is a leading design and construction business creating exceptional places to live. We provide a fully integrated service from concept to project completion, offering our clients a streamlined process, expert insight and intelligent, beautiful design.

Our dedicated team combines a vast wealth of knowledge with technical expertise to craft buildings of award winning, exceptional design and quality. With a number of exciting new commissions and a growing team, we are looking for talented and passionate people to join us.

We are seeking an experienced Senior FP&A Analyst (Financial Planning & Analysis) who is highly capable, motivated and used to handling complex data models.

This role is based in Terrey Hills and is full time, with the option for work-from-home part-time.

About the role

For this role, we require a fully qualified accountant (CA, CPA or ACCA) with strong management accounting experience and confidence working with complex data models.

The Senior FP&A Analyst will lead the development and ongoing improvement of our management reporting. This role is responsible for preparing and maintaining a comprehensive reporting pack that provides clear, accurate insight into the organisationâ€™s financial performance.

A key part of the role involves partnering with stakeholders across the business to understand their reporting needs and delivering information in a clear and practical way. You will work closely with the Financial Controller and senior team members, and will support the Executive Team and department heads by ensuring they have access to reliable financial information to assist with planning and decision-making.

Important to this role, is a strong commercial acumen, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate financial information clearly to non-finance stakeholders. Delivery of services must always be completed efficiently and in a friendly and collaborative manner, reflecting our team-oriented culture.

Construction industry experience is desirable but not essential.

The main responsibilities for the position include:

Produce timely management reporting in collaboration with department heads and the finance team.
Maintain, refine and improve established reporting models and frameworks.
Collaborate with department heads to understand their reporting needs and develop customised reports that meet their requirements.
Drive change through technology by being informed on new and exciting systems that could potentially change the way that information is reported within the business (e.g. Power BI).
Provide insightful commentary on material trends and variances that may impact the business both from an opportunity or risk perspective.
Analyse financial data and information and lead the business planning and budgeting process across the organisation.
Ensure a thorough approach to investigating any discrepancies or uncertainties within the accounts.
Display innovative thinking and problem solving to execute solutions.
Assist with the month-end process to help the Finance Team meet deadlines.
Understand the key operating areas of the Finance Department and make recommendations for improvement.

About You

5+ yearsâ€™ accounting experience, preferably in the construction industry.
Excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Excellent accounting software user.
Confident using IT systems and programs, such as Microsoft suite (including Power BI) and Procore (or similar applications).
Sound decision making skills based on accurate and timely analysis.
Results oriented and metrics driven.
Proficient stakeholder engagement and management.
Ability to apply knowledge in a practical, commercial manner.
Self-starter with an ability to work to deadlines.
Ability to interpret and present financial information in concise ways.
An action-oriented mindset.
Team player with an ability to engage others and collaborate in a team focused environment.
Process orientated.
Can work in a fast-paced environment.

Qualifications

Fully Qualified Accountant (CA, CPA, ACCA)

What we can offer you

Competitive market salary
Hybrid and flexible work options
Paid parental leave
Opportunities for development and career progression
Onsite parking and a new modern office space
Access to an Employee Assistance Program and Wellness Portal
Mental health training and support
Working in a highly creative environment

How to apply

Please use the Apply Now button, and upload a copy of your CV and a Cover Letter explaining why you would be a good fit for Cadence & Co and this role.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

We are proud of our inclusive and diverse culture, driven by our engaged and motivated team. We offer the opportunity to learn, develop and build on your current skills. Working with us will enable you to take ownership of your career and be a part of a growing business.

At our company, we believe that diversity is our strength, and that our people are what make us truly unique. We encourage individuals of all ages, backgrounds, races, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, abilities, and gender identities to apply.

We are Woolworths Group




We are Woolworths Group. 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives connected by a shared Purpose â€“ â€˜to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.â€™ Itâ€™s that Purpose that fuels our ambition to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week.Â 




If youâ€™re excited to turn todayâ€™s blue sky thinking into a better tomorrow for future generations, youâ€™ll find yourself supported and enriched in a dynamic, inclusive and empowering workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve. We believe that the Woolworths Finance team is a high performing, innovative and diverse team across Australia and New Zealand, and is an amazing place to advance your career.Â 




Our teams work in a flexible work environment, including working from home 2 days per week. We are committed to flexibility and believe that it should be mutually beneficial.Â 




The Opportunity




As the Finance Manager for Strategic & Capital Insights, you will serve as a key advisor to the business, driving performance by analysing investment drivers to optimize return on investment of some of our Core capital programs. The role has oversight and accountability for the management, maintenance and integrity of all databases utilised by 360 Finance for performance insights and reporting and will act as the primary systems lead for 360 Finance for the FST program.Â

Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group




As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.

Woolworths Group is an inclusive, team-first company and we value all skills and experiences. If you meet some, but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to submit your application.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Forecasting, Pacing & Commercial Modelling
Salary: Highly competitive salary commensurate with exp
Ad Text:
Keypath Education â€“ Ranked Best Place to Work in Australia by WRK+ (2021 to 2024)

Keypath Education is a global EdTech company partnering with leading universities to deliver online programs that address real-world social and economic challenges.

Work Anywhere:

At Keypath Education Australia, flexibility is our strength. We put our people first, allowing you to choose where you work â€“ from home, in the office, or both. We welcome applications from candidates located anywhere in Australia, provided you have a strong, reliable internet connection.

Please note that only candidates residing in Australia with full working rights will be eligible for consideration.

About the Role

The Senior Analyst, Forecasting, Pacing & Commercial Modelling is Keypathâ€™s enterprise owner of enrolment forecasting, pacing, and commercial modelling across APAC. You will deliver accurate demand scenarios and financial models that inform workforce planning, pricing, investment decisions, annual budgets, and long-range strategic growth.

This role is highly cross-functional and commercially influentialâ€”shaping decisions across Marketing, Sales, Product, Finance, and Strategy.

Key Accountabilities:

Forecasting Governance and Enrolment Modelling

Own the APAC enrolment forecast across partners and study periods.

Maintain and refine forecasting methodology, assumptions, and scenario architecture.

Lead rolling forecasts, study-period reporting, and variance analysis.

Publish forecast packs and run reviews with Sales, Marketing, and Finance.

Develop the annual enrolment forecast aligned to the FY budget.

Real-Time Pacing and Scenario Modelling

Build automated pacing tools for intra-period performance tracking.

Run scenario modelling for promotions, pricing, channel mix, and capacity.

Translate demand scenarios into commercial, operational, and workforce implications.

Commercial & Financial Modelling for Innovation & Growth

Lead financial modelling for new programs, markets, and delivery models.

Support pricing strategies, ROI assessments, business cases, and margin optimisation.

Maintain long-range planning models aligned to growth and investment priorities.

Convert early-stage concepts into robust, defensible commercial models.

Product Performance & Post-Implementation Review

Monitor performance of newly launched products and programs.

Lead post-implementation reviews comparing outcomes against forecast, ROI, and assumptions.

Cross-Functional Integration

Convert enrolment forecasts into staffing needs with Workforce Planning.

Align modelling assumptions across Sales, Marketing, Product, and Finance.

Partner with Data Engineering to ensure automation and data reliability.

Tooling, Governance & Capability Enablement

Enhance automation and quality control across forecasting and commercial models.

Maintain the Forecast & Modelling Playbook.

Coach leaders on forecast interpretation, pacing metrics, and scenario usage.

Foster a culture of analytical rigour and innovation.

Essential Requirements:

Education

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Analytics, Data Science, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.

Postgraduate qualifications (e.g., Masterâ€™s in Applied Analytics, Finance, or Econometrics) are advantageous but not essential.

Experience

8+ years in forecasting, demand modelling, or financial/commercial analytics.

Proven experience building enterprise forecasting frameworks and scenario models.

Strong background in financial modelling for new products, pricing, markets, and ROI analysis.

Experience developing automated pacing dashboards and intervention models.

Confident communicator capable of influencing senior stakeholders.

Experience partnering with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Finance on forecasts and pacing strategies.

Experience working with Data Engineering on automation and data pipelines.

Education sector experience beneficial but not essential.

PLâ€‘300 Power BI certification advantageous.

Technical

Advanced forecasting, scenario modelling, and financial modelling (Excel essential; Python/R optional).

Strong Power BI capability (dashboards, forecast packs, performance reporting).

SQL proficiency and experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Microsoft Fabric).

Ability to build automated pacing and scenario tools integrated into forecasting frameworks.

Excellent executive-level data storytelling and presentation skills.

High numerical reasoning, structured thinking, and meticulous attention to detail.

Unique Requirements

Ability to work across multiple time zones and business units to support forecast governance, pacing reviews, and crossâ€‘functional planning cycles.

Comfortable operating in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment, with shifting demand signals and commercial priorities

Occasional travel may be required.

Additional Information:

Benefits and Rewards:

Opportunity to work in office, hybrid or remote

All the necessary equipment for success.

Internet Allowance for remote work.

Paid Mental Health days for your well-being.

Access to LinkedIn Learning

Learning Labs designed to promote L&D

Toolkits for Digital Health and Mental Health support.

Employee led programs such as Culture Club, Team Green, Sustainability and more

Company events and activities run in office and remotely

Why Keypath?

Embrace Your Authentic Self: A supportive culture recognized as a top workplace (Ranked #6 on 2024 the Best Places to Work AustraliaÂ©).

Global EdTech Leader: Join an industry on the rise.

Continuous Growth: Upskill through discounted study opportunities.

Transform the World: Contribute to upskilling and reskilling globally.

Make an Impact: Help solve future economic and social challenges.

Join Keypath and make a difference. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and offer inclusive support throughout the recruitment process.

Apply now to unlock your potential with Keypath!

Preferred applicants may be required to complete a police check and other pre-employment checks.

Job Title: UKG Integration Lead / Lead Business Analyst
Ad Text:
About the Role

This role supports the functional analysis and delivery of integrations across a complex ST&A and payroll ecosystem, including Workday HCM, UKG (T&A/WFM), Dayforce aPay, Okta, Saviynt, analytics and legacy platforms.

In addition to hands-on analysis, this position will operate in a lead capacity across the integration stream. You will act as the key liaison between business stakeholders, architects, developers, vendors and testing teams, ensuring alignment across requirements, design and delivery.




You will lead workshops, validate integration approaches, oversee data mapping and reconciliation, and support testing, cutover and go-live readiness. A strong focus is ensuring data integrity and cross-system alignment through integration-led data movement.


About You

You are a senior Integration or HR Systems Business Analyst experienced in complex enterprise environments. You are confident facilitating workshops, guiding solution discussions and influencing stakeholders across business and technical teams.

You bring strong integration analysis capability, a structured approach to documentation and testing, and the ability to coordinate across multiple workstreams while driving outcomes.


Key Skills & Experience
Experience leading requirements gathering for system integrations
Strong understanding of HR, payroll, time and attendance and workforce management processes
Hands-on experience with platforms such as Workday, UKG or Dayforce
Experience documenting integration specifications, data mappings and workflows
Strong data analysis and reconciliation capability
Experience supporting integration and end-to-end testing
Strong stakeholder engagement across business, IT and vendors
Nice to Have
Experience with Okta, Saviynt or similar identity platforms
Exposure to integration-led data migration and cutover
Large enterprise or higher education experience
UKG, Workday or Dayforce certifications

This role offers the opportunity to step into a senior, lead-facing position within a significant enterprise transformation program.




Please apply with current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Dylan Tasker on dylan.tasker@davidsonwp.com , quoting reference JN -022026-42382. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

What we can do for you

At Specsavers, we know that to reach your full potential you need to work somewhere that will bringÂ out your best. We pride ourselves on offering a workplace with a supportive, driven, flexible and inclusive culture.

In 2025, we were proudly recognised as one of Australiaâ€™s Best Places to Work for the third consecutive year and ranked 12th on Fortuneâ€™s list of the Worldâ€™s 25 Best Workplaces. Hereâ€™s a taste of just some of our perks:

The Role & Team


As a Data Engineer within our ANZ Data team, youâ€™ll play a key role in transforming business requirements into practical, data-driven solutions. Youâ€™ll be responsible for migrating and shaping data, building views that empower teams across the organisation, and ensuring data is accessible and valuable for decision-making.

In this role, your primary focus will be on data integrity and security. A key part of the role will involve supporting and migrating legacy data systems, which remain essential to our success. By creating repeatable, reliable processes, youâ€™ll ensure our data solutions are robust, scalable, and aligned with business needsâ€”making you an essential part of delivering high-quality outcomes.

Strong technical ability with a solid understanding of big data platforms and their architecture. Proficient in data development tools and ETL processes.

Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to explain technical and business processes in clear, simple language to stakeholders at all levels

Relevant certifications in Azure Databricks or Azure Data Engineering is preferred

About Us

Specsavers are rated the market leader for eye tests, the retailer of choice for contact lenses and one of the fastest growing hearing providers in Australia and New Zealand. We are on a continual mission to transform eye and hearing health by eliminating preventable vision loss and blindness, including Glaucoma and Diabetes, through improved prevention and early detection, as well as providing accessible and affordable hearing care.

At Specsavers we believe a diverse, inclusive, and flexible culture enables our people to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. We currently have an opportunity for a Data Manager in Canberra or Melbourne to work on Land projects.


Join our Downer Professional Services team and play a key role in delivering complex defence and national security projects that safeguard Australia's future.



Downer Professional Services comprises of three business units our Technical, Advisory, and Capability consulting practice, and Team Downer, which partners with CASG and NSSG as a major service provider to Defence. Together, we are a multi-disciplinary advisory and delivery partner of choice for clients across Defence and National Security.



We currently have an opportunity for a Data Manager in Canberra or Melbourne to work on Land projects.



What You'll Do


This role offers a broad scope, with key role responsibilities including:




Data & Information Management: Develop, maintain, and improve processes for storing, sharing, and managing project data using Defence systems (Objective, SharePoint, DOORS, Teams).





Quality & Compliance: Support Project Quality Management Systems (QMS) and ensure compliance with ISO 9001:2015 standards.





Technical Support & Training: Provide assistance and training to project personnel on applications, online systems, and data management practices.





Governance & Reporting: Prepare briefs, reports, and submissions for governance forums, while coordinating project and contract meetings.





Stakeholder & Procurement Engagement: Collaborate with Defence, industry, and contractors to manage procurement activities, evaluate responses, and build effective stakeholder relationships.



What You'll Bring





Data Management Expertise: Demonstrated experience as a Data Manager (or similar) on complex, highly technical Defence capability projects.





Quality & Compliance Knowledge: Strong understanding of Defence Quality Management Systems (QMS) and ISO 9001 standards.





Systems & Tools Proficiency: High-level experience with Defence information and records management systems such as Objective, SharePoint, DOORS, and Predict.





Workflow & Documentation Control: Proven ability to develop and manage document workflows, ensuring version control and chain of custody.





Stakeholder & Communication Skills: Effective collaboration in complex stakeholder environments, with advanced technical writing and strong verbal communication skills.




Due to the nature of the work, you are required to currently hold and maintain a minimum Negative Vetting 1 or higher Security clearance as required by the Commonwealth. In some instances, compliance with International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements may also be an inherent requirement.


More than anything, you'll bring a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and a commitment to delivering high-quality outcomes for our clients.



Why Downer Professional Services


At Downer Professional Services, we're not just a workplace - we're a business dedicated to contributing to the shaping of the future of defence in Australia. As the country's only sovereign prime, we're committed to making a real difference in protecting Australia's interests.



What is means to belong at Downer Professional Services








Meaningful work: Help to deliver critical Defence projects that protect Australia and shape its future.



Professional development: Access career mapping, accelerated learning programs, and shared learning through our Communities of Practice.



Great perks: Enjoy discounts on healthcare, retail, vehicles, and more through Perks@Downer.



Veteran support: Benefit from initiatives like up to 20 days of Reservist Leave to stay connected post-service.



You want your work to matter and so do we. With over 26,000 people across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific, our team is made up of individuals with unique perspectives, backgrounds, and ideas.

We know that diversity makes us stronger and we actively celebrate it through our commitment to inclusion and belonging.



We're committed to building a team that reflects the diverse communities we serve and we welcome people of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, cultures, abilities, and lived experiences. We especially encourage applications from those whose voices have traditionally been underrepresented in our industry, including women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, MÄori and Pasifika Peoples, veterans, people with disability, and neurodivergent individuals. Even if your experience doesn't align perfectly with this role, we'd still like to hear from you. If it feels like the right fit, apply - potential counts, and so do you.

If you need support or adjustments through the recruitment process, just let us know, we're here to help you put your best foot forward.

Aurelia Metals Limited is an ASX-listed, Australian-owned gold and base metals company based in NSW. We operate the Peak and Federation underground mines and are progressing the Great Cobar Project, a high-grade copper development near Peak.

We are proud to be a WORK180 endorsed employer, with inclusion, safety, and our Values at the heart of everything we do. With one of the most prospective land positions in the Cobar Basin, we are unlocking value through discovery, development, and growth.

The Great Cobar Project, with an eight-year mine plan and strong exploration upside, will drive the next generation of growth at Aurelia and create diverse career pathways for those wanting to be part of a high-performance, forward-thinking culture.




About the roleÂ 

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Financial Planning and Analysis Manager to join our team. Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer, this is a highly visible role where you will act as a trusted advisor, bringing clarity, insight, and thoughtful challenge to support strategic decision-making across the business.

In this role, you will manage the FP&A function, providing high-quality financial and economic insights that support business planning, growth initiatives, and key projects across the Company. While the role has no direct reports, you will lead through influence, partnering closely with leaders and the executive team to drive alignment and deliver meaningful outcomes.

You are someone who brings both strong technical capability and a collaborative approach, with the ability to translate complex financial information into clear, practical insights. Your experience in financial planning and analysis, ideally within the resources sector, will enable you to provide accurate and timely guidance that supports confident decision-making.

With a naturally engaging communication style and strong commercial awareness, you build trusted relationships across all levels of the organisation. You are comfortable balancing strategic thinking with hands-on delivery and thrive in an environment where you can make a genuine impact.

Â

Location:Â Brisbane CBD

Lead the Group planning cycle, including life of mine plans, annual budgets, and forecasts

Consolidate operational submissions and present outcomes to the leadership team and Board

Conduct detailed analysis and scenario modelling on group performance, cash flow, and commodity price sensitivities

Manage the Group planning system (Workday Adaptive), including ongoing development and enhancements

Coordinate risk assessments at each stage of the planning cycle

Oversee capital governance, including approval processes and intra-year forecasts

Deliver financial analysis (variance, trends, benchmarking) to support reporting and cost-saving opportunities

Manage the group cash flow model and provide regular updates to leadership, Board, and financiers

Provide financial modelling and analysis for ad hoc projects, supporting Technical Services and Growth teams

Support major contract tenders through financial evaluation

Monitor external analyst coverage and identify opportunities to align market forecasts with Aureliaâ€™s messaging




Qualifications and experience

Tertiary qualification in business, finance, or a mining-related discipline

Proven experience in corporate planning, financial modelling, and investment analysis within complex environments

Strong understanding of mining processes and value chain interdependencies

Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills

Familiarity with Power BI, QlikView, or Workday Adaptive (desirable)
